Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The Dutch simply react with an even deeper sense of underlying arrogance and apathetic cynicism.

After watching this movie, I couldn't help but notice the parallels between it and another film called America 3000. Both were very bad mid 1980's scifi movies that feature a girl who fantasizes about robots (like Wall-e) making her life better. In both cases she risks everything to escape into space where all of her one dimensional undesirable qualities are suddenly gone and in their place we see her become a heroine worthy of tribute in modern day pop culture.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that they are going up against an alien monster.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to create a cult phenomenon with its blatant spoofing of martial arts films and ultimately it does and has gained its status. It is a fun and light-hearted action comedy acted well enough but also featuring some innovative stunts and fight sequences which were rare for 1993
